API Reference¶

Piotr API

This module allows to interact with/instrument Piotr virtual devices in a pythonic way. It exposes a main class, Piotr, that is able to interact with running instances and to automate things.

class piotr.api.Debugger(inst_name, pid, ip=None, port=4444, gdb='gdb-multiarch')[source]¶

This class is a wrapper for avatar2’s GDBProtocol class that will handle gdb-multiarch.

cont(blocking=True)[source]¶

Continue execution.

on_debugger_msg(message)[source]¶

Process async message sent by gdb

Parameters:message – message
read_memory(address, wordsize=4, num_words=1, raw=False)[source]¶

reads memory :param address: Address to write to :param wordsize: the size of a read word (1, 2, 4 or 8) :param num_words: the amount of read words :param raw: Whether the read memory should be returned unprocessed :return: The read memory

read_register(reg)[source]¶

Read register

remove_breakpoint(bkpt)[source]¶

Deletes a breakpoint

set_abi(abi)[source]¶

Set ABI.

set_breakpoint(line, hardware=False, temporary=False, regex=False, condition=None, ignore_count=0, thread=0, pending=False)[source]¶

Inserts a breakpoint

Parameters:
  • hardware (bool) – Hardware breakpoint
  • temporary (bool) – Tempory breakpoint
  • regex (str) – If set, inserts breakpoints matching the regex
  • condition (str) – If set, inserts a breakpoint with specified condition
  • ignore_count (int) – Amount of times the bp should be ignored
  • thread (int) – Threadno in which this breakpoints should be added
Returns:

The number of the breakpoint
stop()[source]¶

Stop execution of target.

wait(blocking=True)[source]¶

Wait for target to be stopped.

write_memory(address, wordsize, val, num_words=1, raw=False)[source]¶

Writes memory

Parameters:
  • address – Address to write to
  • wordsize – the size of the write (1, 2, 4 or 8)
  • val (int if num_words == 1 and raw == False list if num_words > 1 and raw == False str or byte if raw == True) – the written value
  • num_words – The amount of words to read
  • raw – Specifies whether to write in raw or word mode
Returns:

True on success else False
class piotr.api.Device(deviceName)[source]¶

API Device object.

get_sysroot()[source]¶

Return this device root fs path

run(alias=None, background=False)[source]¶

Run emulated device.

exception piotr.api.DeviceNotFound[source]¶
class piotr.api.Instance(pid, device, sock, instName)[source]¶

This class represents a Piotr running device instance and allows to interact with it, execute commands into the emulated host and target (if Qemu agent is supported by the device), enumerate and manipulate process.

Parameters:
  • pid (int) – PID of Qemu instance
  • device (str) – Name of parent device, as referenced in Piotr devices list
  • sock (str) – Socket file used to communicate with Qemu agent
  • instName (str) – Instance name, as referenced in Piotr running instances
debug(pid, ip='0.0.0.0', port=4444, gdb_executable='gdb-multiarch')[source]¶

Runs a gdb server and attaches it to a process.

exec_host(command, wait=True)[source]¶

Execute a command in host.

exec_target(command, wait=True)[source]¶

Execute a command in guest.

Parameters:
  • command (str) – command to execute
  • return_output (bool) – wait for the process to end and return output
Returns:

command output or executable PID
